meanings.definition: To reverse the effects of something that has been done.
meanings.sent1: She undid the knot in the rope to free the trapped bird.
meanings.sent2: He quickly undid his mistake by apologizing to his friend.
meanings.sent3: The magician undid the trick, revealing how it was done.
meanings.sent4: The detective undid the mystery, solving the case in record time.
meanings.sent5: With a swift move, she undid the damage caused by the spilled paint.

meanings.definition: To cause the downfall or ruin of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The villain's evil plan undid the peace in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The storm undid all the hard work the farmers had put into their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat undid the neatly arranged books on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The false testimony undid the defendant's chances of winning the case.
meanings.sent5: The careless mistake undid all the progress made on the project.
